meanings.definition: To open (a door, lock, etc.) by turning a key or moving a lock
meanings.sent1: I unlock the door with my key every day after school.
meanings.sent2: She always unlocks the gate before letting the dog out.
meanings.sent3: The key was so stubborn, it took me a while to unlock the door!
meanings.sent4: His smile seemed to unlock the secret to her heart.
meanings.sent5: The magician used a special trick to unlock the mysterious box.

meanings.definition: To remove a lock or other obstruction from (a door, window, box, etc.)
meanings.sent1: Dad will unlock the safe to get our special treats.
meanings.sent2: The locksmith had to unlock the old chest to reveal its contents.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel managed to unlock the bird feeder and steal the seeds!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to unlock the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight seemed to unlock the beauty hidden within the garden.

meanings.definition: To release from a locked or closed position
meanings.sent1: The firefighter rushed to unlock the trapped cat from the burning house.
meanings.sent2: After the storm, they had to unlock the jammed door to get out.
meanings.sent3: The key to unlock the treasure chest was hidden under the rock.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to unlock the emotions she had kept hidden.
meanings.sent5: The melody of the song seemed to unlock memories long forgotten.
